translation: przetarcie [a place where the surface of something, such as skin, has been rubbed away]
sentence: She had a small abrasion on her knee.

translation: zawiły, niejasny, niezrozumiały [not known or understood by many people]
sentence: The analysis is clearly written and renders these sometimes quite abstruse theories more accessible.

translation: wyniosły (z boku) [not friendly or willing to take part in things]
sentence: She seemed rather aloof when in fact she was just shy.

translation: przychylny (otwarty)
sentence: She may be more amenable to the idea now.

translation: rodowy [relating to members of your family from the past]
sentence: Ancestral estate was strictly tied to the family.

translation: żarliwie [in a way that shows strong feelings]
sentence: Too often we ardently pursue the wrong things.

translation: żmudny
sentence: They searched arduously for clues.

translation: wzbudzać (też: pobudzać seksualnie) [to cause someone to have a particular feeling]
sentence: It's a subject that has aroused a lot of interest.

translation: pomyślny [formal; suggesting a positive and successful future]
sentence: Their first meeting was hardly auspicious.

translation: niechęć, awersja [(a person or thing that causes) a feeling of strong dislike or of not wishing to do something]
sentence: She has a deep aversion to getting up in the morning.

translation: wróżyć (być wróżbą) [formal or literary; to be a sign of something that will happen in the future, usually something very good or bad]
sentence: The hurricane bodes disaster for those areas in its path.

translation: piracki, podrobiony [illegally made, copied, or sold]
sentence: But shops and artists who purchase bootleg flash art are cheating themselves, too.

translation: obcesowy [confident in an aggressive way]
sentence: Beneath his brash exterior, he's still a little boy inside.

translation: bachor [informal; a child, especially one who behaves badly]
sentence: She's behaving like a spoilt brat.

translation: rozszczepiony [used to describe something, especially an animal's hoof, that is divided into two parts]
sentence: The devil was painted with horns and cloven hoofs.

translation: prostacki
sentence: I was shocked with his coarse language.

translation: skrupuły [formal; a slight guilty feeling about something you have done or might do]
sentence: I would have no compunction about quitting.

translation: począć, zajść w ciążę [to become pregnant, or to cause a baby to begin to form]
sentence: Do you know exactly when you conceived?

translation: przewód (lub połączenie dwóch rzeczy)
sentence: He designed the conduit for conveying water to the power plant.

translation: łączyć [to join with something, or to join things together]
sentence: The units can be conjoined to form grids.

translation: antykoncepcja [(the use of) any of various methods intended to prevent a woman becoming pregnant]
sentence: They offer impartial advice on contraception.

translation: łamigłówka, zagadka [a question that is a trick, often involving a humorous use of words that have two meanings]
sentence: Here again, we are being asked these legal conundrums.

translation: dwuwiersz [two lines of poetry next to each other, especially ones that rhyme (= have words with the same sounds) and have the same length and rhythm]
sentence: The children's book contained a short couplet on each page.

translation: nieśmiały (lub: tajemniczy)
sentence: She's very coy about her age.

translation: naczynie do topienia metalu
sentence: A crucible is a pot in which substances are heated to high temperatures, metals are melted.

translation: śmiałek, szaleniec [a person who does dangerous things and takes risks]
sentence: He loved to play practical jokes and was a daredevil as a child.

translation: rozkład, rozpad (w tym radioaktywny) [to gradually become bad or weak or be destroyed, often because of natural causes like bacteria or age]
sentence: Sugar makes your teeth decay.

translation: raczyć, zechcieć łaskawie [to do something in a way that shows you think you are too important to do it]
sentence: She just grunted, not deigning to look up from the page.

translation: nabrzmienie [the act of swelling and becoming large by pressure from inside]
sentence: Gaseous distension of the bowel causes considerable discomfort to the patient.

translation: żartobliwy [humorous, especially in an unusual way]
sentence: So they've locked me out of the house? Very droll, I'm sure!

translation: podniecać [make (someone) ecstatically happy]
sentence: I felt elated at winning the tournament.

translation: zdobyć, uzyskać [formal; to get or produce something, especially information or a reaction]
sentence: Have you managed to elicit a response from them yet?

translation: ekscytujące
sentence: My first parachute jump was an exhilarating experience.

translation: nieuprawiany, leżący odłogiem [(of farm land) not used for growing crops, especially so that the quality of the land will improve]
sentence: Farmers are now paid to let their land lie fallow.

translation: lojalność [loyalty, especially to a king or queen]
sentence: The new prelate took the oath of fealty to Hugh Capet and persuaded Gerbert to remain with him.

translation: przerażający [formal]
sentence: The cat mewed, displaying a fearsome set of teeth.

translation: jątrzyć się [(of a wound or cut) to become badly infected; (of bad feelings or thoughts) to become much worse because you do not deal with them successfully]
sentence: Instead of talking the matter over with him, she allowed her resentment to fester in her mind.

translation: wiotki, sflaczały [soft and fat; weak and without force]
sentence: I was starting to get a bit flabby around my waist.

translation: ekstrawagancki [very confident in your behavior, and liking to be noticed by other people, for example because of the way you dress, talk, etc.]
sentence: The writer's flamboyant lifestyle was well known.

translation: płomienisty [burning and covered in flames]
sentence: Flaming fragments were still falling from the sky.

translation: trzepotać
sentence: Butterflies fluttered about in the sunshine.

translation: słabość [weakness and lack of health or strength]
sentence: Though ill for most of her life, physical frailty never stopped her from working.

translation: liść praproci lub palmy [a long, thin leaf of a plant]
sentence: Ferns and palms have fronds.

translation: przepasać [old use; to tie something around your body or part of your body]
sentence: The company is girding its loins for a plunge into the overseas market.

translation: lśnić, błyszczeć [to shine by reflecting light from a wet or smooth surface]
sentence: His eyes glistened with tears.

translation: krwawy [involving violence and blood]
sentence: He insisted on telling us all the gory details about their divorce.

translation: krwotok [a large flow of blood from a damaged blood vessel]
sentence: Serious haemorrhage may occur at any time throughout pregnancy.

translation: toporek
sentence: If you are a boy, go and get your hatchet, and set off for the mountains to chop wood!

translation: spustoszenie, zniszczenie [confusion and lack of order, especially causing damage or trouble]
sentence: These insects can wreak havoc on crops.

translation: ciskać, miotać [to throw something with a lot of force, usually in an angry or violent way]
sentence: In a fit of temper he hurled the book across the room.

translation: uczynić niezdolnym [to make someone unable to work or do things normally, or unable to do what they intended to do]
sentence: He was incapacitated by illness and old age.

translation: rozpieszczać, pobłażać, dogadzać [to allow yourself or another person to have something enjoyable, especially more than is good for you]
sentence: The soccer fans indulged their patriotism, waving flags and singing songs.

translation: odwołać się [formal; to mention a person, a theory, an example, etc. to support your opinions or ideas, or as a reason for something]
sentence: Police can invoke the law to regulate access to these places.

translation: bezpowrotnie [in a way that is impossible to change]
sentence: He came back from the war irrevocably changed.

translation: uzasadniony, słuszny [having a good reason]
sentence: Her actions were quite justifiable in the circumstances.

translation: cierpieć, gnić (gdzieś) [to exist in an unpleasant or unwanted situation, often for a long time]
sentence: She continues to languish in a foreign prison.

translation: półka, parapet
sentence: The birds landed on a ledge about halfway up the cliff.

translation: zmiana patologiczna, obrażenie
sentence: This may then progress later into organic lesion.

translation: ukołysać [to cause someone to feel calm or to feel that they want to sleep]
sentence: The motion of the car almost lulled her to sleep.

translation: mahoń
sentence: Mahogany is one of the most valuable cabinet woods.

translation: zabójstwo [the crime of killing a person when the killer did not intend to do it or cannot be responsible for his or her actions]
sentence: She was sentenced to five years' imprisonment for manslaughter.

translation: zamęt, chaos [a situation in which there is little or no order or control]
sentence: With 20 kids running around and only two adults to supervise, it was complete mayhem.

translation: niewykwalifikowany (nie wymagające kwalifikacji)
sentence: It's fairly menial work, such as washing dishes and cleaning floors.

translation: zaleta, zasługa [formal; the quality of being good and deserving praise]
sentence: Brierley's book has the merit of being both informative and readable.

translation: opłakiwać [to feel or express great sadness, especially because of someone's death]
sentence: She was still mourning for her brother.

translation: różnorodny [of many different types]
sentence: The newspaper report detailed the fraudster's multifarious business activities.

translation: chrupać [to eat something, especially noisily]
sentence: He was munching on an apple.

translation: nikczemny [formal; (especially of activities) morally bad]
sentence: The company's CEO seems to have been involved in some nefarious practices/activities.

translation: przekąska (lub: posiłek) [informal; a small amount of food eaten between meals or as a meal]
sentence: I have a little nosh at about 10.30, so I don't overeat at lunch.

translation: tępota [formal; the quality of being stupid and slow to understand, or unwilling to try to understand]
sentence: He shook his head at his own obtuseness.

translation: wiosłować (też: wiosło) [to push a pole with a wide end through the water in order to make a boat move]
sentence: She paddled her canoe across the lake.

translation: kapryśny
sentence: He behaved like a petulant child and refused to cooperate.

translation: molo [a long structure that is built from the land out over the sea and sometimes has entertainments, restaurants, etc on it]
sentence: After lunch, the family went for a walk along the pier.

translation: wzruszający
sentence: The photograph awakens poignant memories of happier days.

translation: ślamazarny, wolny [informal US]
sentence: I wish you wouldn't be so poky when you're getting ready.

translation: napędzać, popychać [to push or move something somewhere, often with a lot of force]
sentence: Fury propelled her into action.

translation: grasować [to move around quietly in a place trying not to be seen or heard, such as an animal does when hunting]
sentence: At night, adult scorpions prowl the desert for insects.

translation: dziecinny [behaving in a silly way, not like an adult]
sentence: I find his sense of humor rather puerile.

translation: grabie [a garden tool with a long handle and long, pointed metal parts sticking out in a row at the bottom, used for making the earth level or for collecting leaves, etc.]
sentence: Fetch the rake from the shed.

translation: ochrypły [loud and unpleasant]
sentence: I heard the raucous call of the crows.

translation: próbować, odbywać próbę [to practise a play, a piece of music, etc. in order to prepare it for public performance]
sentence: We were given only two weeks to rehearse.

translation: nowicjusz, rekrut [informal; a person who is new to an organization or an activity]
sentence: These rookie cops don't know anything yet.

translation: strup [a layer of dried blood that forms to cover a cut in the skin]
sentence: Don’t pick at your scab!

translation: pochwa miecza [a long, thin cover for the blade of a sword, usually attached to a belt]
sentence: A ceremonial sword hung at his side in a gilded scabbard.

translation: zgnieść [to crush material such as paper or cloth into a rough ball in the hand]
sentence: He scrunched up the note and threw it on the fire.

translation: zagajnik, krzewy [a part of a garden where a lot of shrubs have been planted]
sentence: Pipes will be covered by bracken, trees and shrubbery.

sentence: Leave the vegetables to simmer for a few minutes.

translation: osmalić [to burn slightly on the surface, without producing flames]
sentence: My sweater started to singe when I leaned over a burning candle.

translation: wrażliwy, delikatny [easily upset or shocked by things that you find unpleasant or that you do not approve of]
sentence: She's really squeamish and can't stand the sight of blood.

sentence: The procession made its stately progress through the streets of the city.

sentence: We've just bought some stools for the kitchen.

translation: pochylać się [to bend the top half of the body forward and down]

translation: subtelność [the quality of being subtle; a small but important detail]

translation: powierzchowny [(of a person) never thinking about things that are serious or important]
sentence: He's fun to be with, but he's very superficial.

translation: zbyteczny [more than is needed or wanted]

translation: nużący
sentence: The problem is I find most forms of exercise so tedious.

sentence: We used some dry grass as tinder to light the campfire.

sentence: The success of the event will be determined by the vagaries of the weather.

translation: nieufnie
sentence: She eyed the dog warily, afraid it might jump.

translation: ważki, poważny

translation: dzicz, pustkowie [an outside area in which plants are left to grow naturally or untidily]
sentence: The garden was a wilderness of weeds and overgrown bushes.

translation: jakość wykonania, fachowość [the skill with which something was made or done]
sentence: Our buyers insist on high standards of workmanship and materials.
